title: "Across The Field" FONT ID needed
content:
Looking for a font Id on this pretty looking script type. any help would be greatly appreciated. thanks,  
Danny

 ![](http://web.archive.org/web/20120718024751im_/http:/typophile.com/files/AcrosstheField_4844.jpg)

| Attachment | Size |
| --- | --- |
| [AcrosstheField.jpg](http://web.archive.org/web/20120718024751/http:/typophile.com/files/AcrosstheField.jpg) | 91.8 KB |
author: Danny_Miller

comments.content:
That's close Stewf, but not exact. This is Spoleto (a.k.a. Sport Script, and other names).

- Mike Yanega

Here's the sample from the Script Font ID Guide.

- Mike Yanega

 ![](http://web.archive.org/web/20120718024751im_/http:/typophile.com/files/Spoleto_3647.gif)
Not the same, but a new stylish take on the baseball script is Leslie Cabarga's [Casey](http://web.archive.org/web/20120718024751/http:/fontbureau.com/fonts/Casey).
Mike schools me again. My apologies for not double checking!

mike-  
following your threads and googling "OPTISport-Script", "Aktuelle" and "Spoleto" i was still unable to find the font online for purchase or download. The closest i came to was this link: [http://www.qbf.de/dceng.htm](http://web.archive.org/web/20120718024751/http:/www.qbf.de/dceng.htm "http://www.qbf.de/dceng.htm") , which claims it has the font for sale but doesn't register the font in my shopping cart. Do you know how/where I could acquire this font? I'm desperate! thanks so much for your help,  
danny

I see what you mean about not being able to load the cart. I have "Spoleto" and I would be willing to set some words in it for you, and send you a graphic. That's the best I can offer. You can e-mail me through my Typophile profile.

- Mike Yanega
